info.headline: Frost Advisory issued October 12 at 3:03AM MDT until October 13 at 9:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
* WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, west winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 60 mph expected. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 28 will result in frost formation.
* WHERE...East Platte County and South Laramie Range Foothills.
* WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, from 6 AM this morning to 6 PM MDT this evening. For the Frost Advisory, from midnight tonight to 9 AM MDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Mainly to transportation. Strong cross winds will be hazardous to light weight or high profile vehicles, including campers and tractor trailers. Frost could harm sensitive outdoor vegetation. Sensitive outdoor plants may be killed if left uncovered.
info.instruction:
A High Wind Warning means a hazardous high wind event is expected or occurring. Sustained wind speeds of at least 40 MPH or gusts of 58 MPH or stronger can lead to property damage.
Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.

parameter.value: HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 9 AM MDT MONDAY

area.areaDesc: East Platte County; South Laramie Range Foothills
